content: stepping out sizes adult s/m l/x-l fits head circumference 21/22 23/24 inches around materials  size 4mm 6 us 16 circular needles 2 pairs if you make the double brim the second pair doesn t need to be exact size can be smaller ex 3 5mm us  size 4 5mm 7 us 16 circular needles and double pointed needles or size needed for gauge  approx 105 115 metres 115 125 yds for single brim or 130 160 metres 140 175 yds for double brim of worsted / aran weight yarn samples are shown in malabrigo worsted  one stitch marker and yarn needle  5 decorative buttons optional gauge approx 20 sts x 28 rnds = 4 in slightly stretched chart a pattern using 4 5mm 7 us needles directions single brim cast on 96 108 sts using long-tail or preferred stretchy method and smaller needles place marker and join to work in the round being careful not to twist the stitches work as follows round 1 k2 p1 around repeat round 1 until ribbing measures 2 2 ¼ proceed with body chart a folded with wrong sides facing each other double brim spare needle with 4mm 6 us needles and provisional cast on co 96 108 sts place marker and join to work in the round being careful not to twist the stitches work as follows working needle round 1 k2 p1 around repeat round 1 until ribbing measures 4 4 ½ unzip your provisional cast on placing live stitches 96 108 onto spare circular needles weave in ends on the wrong side fold the hem up with the wrong sides facing each other placing both circular needles parallel to one another with spare needles on the inside slide marker to the right needle of the working needles continue in k2 p1 and picking up one front working st together with one back cast on st together for the entire round proceed with body chart a knit 1 front and 1 back stitch together body chart a switch to larger needles *note that each round it knit four times* chart a body rnds 1 - 4 k4 p2 around 21 - 24 rnds 5 - 8 p1 k4 p1 around 17 - 20 rnds 9 - 12 p2 k4 around 13 - 16 rnds 13 - 16 k1 p2 k3 around 9 - 12 rnds 17 - 20 k2 p2 k2 around 5 - 8 1 - 4 rnds 21 - 24 k3 p2 k1 around 6 5 4 3 2 1 repeat rounds 1-24 and then rnds 1-4 1-8 once more hat measures approx 6 6 ¾ from bottom edge crown chart b set-up for s/m remove marker p1 k4 replace marker continue with chart b *if you want a slouch or need to change the length of the hat continue with body chart ending with a fourth row of any of the rnds to set-up for the crown remove marker and knit continuing the pattern
